p: Although there has been great progress in the prevention of cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), circulatory system disorders and heart failures are still the leading cause of death globally. It is well known that proper eating habits, regular physical activity, elimination of smoking, and low body weight are essential factors in cardiovascular risk reducing, but despite this common knowledge, CVDs are still the major cause of death worldwide, causing 17.3 million deaths per year (reported by the World Heart Federation in the Urbanization and Cardiovascular Disease report) [ 3].
